articles.author: Iain Thomson
articles.title: Ariane 5 takes its final flight, leaving Europe without its own heavy-lift rocket - The Register
articles.description: Independence Day launch will leave Europe dependent on the US for space missions
articles.content: On Tuesday July 4, the last Ariane 5 rocket will blast off from the Kourou spaceport in French Guiana. As the rocket's red glare fades, Europe will be without a heavy-lift rocket for the first time i… [+4753 chars]

articles.title: The space telescope surveying the entire universe to understand dark matter and dark energy - The Verge
articles.description: The European Space Agency’s Euclid mission launched a space telescope to better understand dark matter and dark energy, two of the most mysterious phenomena in the universe.
